title: Two 3-D Cluster-Based Frameworks: Highly Eight-Connected Molecular Topology and Magnetism
abstract: Two highly eight-connected coordination polymers have been established:

A couple of metal-organic frameworks (MOFs) constructed from rigid bicarboxylates are presented herein, namely, Co

ndc = 2,6-naphthalenedicarboxylic acid, bipy = 2,2′-pyridine, and bbi = 1,1′-(1,4-butanediyl)bis(imidazole). These two coordination polymers have been prepared through solvo/hydrothermal reactions and characterized by single-crystal X-ray study, TG, IR, and elemental analysis. Polymer
features a novel self-penetrating network mediated by flexible long-chain ligand and well defines a unique 4
topology with the treatment of Co
unit as an 8-connected node, which equals the highest connectivity for monometallic self-penetrating system so far. Polymer

·6 framework upon the assignment of Dy
cluster to an 8-connected node. In addition, magnetic studies of

text: Construction and characterization of highly entangled network solids has attracted significant interest, not only due to their aesthetic appeal and interesting topologies
but also due to the potential applications of such materials.

Recently, there has been much progress in the discovery of entangled polymeric systems such as self-penetrating (self-catenating) networks, interpenetrating (polycatenating) networks, and rotaxanes. However, the majority of the reported entanglements fall into the interpenetrating category, as evidenced by several comprehensive reviews providing some insightful information on the rationalization and classification of their topologies.

Unlike interpenetration, self-penetrating networks, as another type of tangled motifs, are single nets that exhibit the peculiar feature of containing rings which pass through other components of the same network, and these rings must be topological shortest circuits of the net. To date, although considerable efforts have been directed to the construction of self-penetrating nets, only a limited number of cases are known.
After all, the achievement of self-penetration continues to be a great challenge since it is comparatively difficult to predict the target compound prior to synthesis.

In order to design such materials, control over the appropriate reaction conditions plays a key role in the synthetic procedure. The polymer topology strongly depends upon the chemical structure of ligands, the coordinative propensity of metal ions, solvent preference, and metal-to-ligand molar ratio, etc. While numerous organic molecules have been utilized as spacers, coordination polymers tuned by the coligands of carboxylates and N-donor molecules have witnessed an expansion development.
As we found, those ligands bearing flexible lengths, charge-balance requirements, and different orientations of donor groups are likely to furnish advantages in the organization of novel frameworks.
One such ligand having O-donors with multiple coordination modes is 2,6-naphthalenedicarboxylic acid, a member of the polycarboxylates family.
Furthermore, since those nonrigid ligands favor the fabrication of entangled motifs,
a flexible long-chain imidazole-based 1,1′-(1,4-butanediyl)bis(imidazole) is combined with rigid or semirigid polycarboxylates to exploit 3-D self-penetrating networks.

On the other hand, lanthanide-transition-metal chemistry has been of great significance in the field of molecular magnetism. Particularly, 3d-4f cluster-based coordination polymers are expected to offer the possibility of single molecule magnet (SMM) in terms of the basic requirements such as high-spin ground-state and magnetic anisotropy. In the past, however, most research attention for the 3d-4f cluster complexes was primarily devoted to Gd
systems. As expected, Dy−Mn cluster-based complex seems to be an ideal choice for magnetic materials, and very few cases were reported to construct from such type of clusters, including [Mn

Although a variety of cluster-based SBUs have been established in various MOFs, the generation of high-connected topologies are extremely scarce as a result of the limited coordination number on transition metal centers.
Herein, we report in detail the synthesis and properties of two novel 3-D MOFs, Co
contains an 8-connected topology, which, to the best of our knowledge, represents the highest connectivity net for self-penetration, equal to four others (with different topologies).
exhibits an unprecedented 8-connected net with heteropentanuclear Dy
The reagents and solvents employed were commercially available and were used as received without further purification. Ligand bbi was synthesized as reported previously.
The IR spectrum was recorded as KBr pellets on a Nicolet Magna-FT-IR 560 spectrometer in the 4000−400 cm

region. Elemental analysis for C, H, and N was performed on a Perkin-Elmer 240 analyzer. X-ray powder diffraction (XRPD) data were collected with a Rigaku D/max-RC diffractometer using a Cu target (λ = 1.54060 Å) operated at 50 kV and 180 mA. The thermogravimetric (TG) analysis was investigated on a standard TGA analyzer under nitrogen flow at a heating rate of 3 °C/min for all measurements. The magnetic measurements were performed on the Quantum Design SQUID MPMS XL-7 instruments. The diamagnetism of the sample and sample holder were taken into account.
ndc (0.22 g, 1.0 mmol) and bbi (0.06 g, 0.33 mmol) in the molar ratio of 3:3:1 was added into 6 mL of CH

CN. Consequently, the resulting solution was transferred and sealed in a 25 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel, which was heated at 140 °C for 60 h. After the reactor was slowly cooled to room temperature at a rate of 5 °C/h, pure purple block-shaped crystals were filtered off, and dried in air. Yield: 66% based on Co. Elemental analysis (%) calcd, C 55.01, H 3.51, N 7.70; found, C 55.03, H 3.55, N 7.72. IR (KBr): ν (cm
ndc (0.32 g, 1.5 mmol) and bipy (0.08 g, 0.50 mmol) in the molar ratio of 1:3:6:2 was dissolved in distilled water (6 mL). This solution was then adjusted to pH 2 with HNO

. Consequently, the resulting solution was transferred and sealed in a 25 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel, which was heated at 180 °C for three days. After the reactor was slowly cooled to room temperature at a rate of 5 °C/h, yellow block-shaped crystals were filtered off, washed with distilled water, and dried in air. Yield: 62% based on Dy. Elemental analysis (%) calcd, C 52.94, H 2.51, N 2.68; found, C 52.97, H 2.48, N 2.65. IR (KBr): ν (cm

In summary, we have successfully developed a rational synthetic strategy for desired architectures causing the construction of two interesting MOFs composed of cluster-based SBUs. Toward this effort, a novel 8-connected networks with 4
topology is presented for the first time which equals the highest connectivity for monometallic self-penetrating networks. We have also established an unprecedented heteropentanuclear Dy
·6 networks with the treatment of cluster-based Dy
SBU as a node in which soft ferromagnetic behavior is confirmed. Such investigations demonstrate the utility of current methodology and versatility of rigid H

ndc for the high-dimensional supramolecules. As a result of the above impetus, continuous attempts are underway to prepare novel coordination polymers with unique attributes and desirable applications.

Coexisting covalent and noncovalent nets: parallel interpenetration of a puckered rectangular coordination polymer and aromatic noncovalent nets
Lu, Jianjiang; Moulton, Brian; Zaworotko, Michael J.; Bourne, Susan A.

[Zn(isophthalate)(1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethane)]n·xA (A = benzene, nitrobenzene, toluene, benzaldehyde, dioxane) were prepd. by self-assembly and characterized by x-ray crystallog.  These two-dimensional puckered rectangular polymeric complexes contg. arom. guest mols. represent the 1st examples of parallel interpenetration between noncovalent and metal-org. frameworks.  The absence of a suitable component to form noncovalent nets affords a novel three-dimensional supramol. isomer of the coordination polymer.
The first 'two-over/two-under' (2O/2U) 2D weave structure assembled from Hg-containing 1D coordination polymer chains
Li, Yun-Hui; Su, Cheng-Yong; Goforth, Andrea M.; Shimizu, Ken D.; Gray, Kenneth D.; Smith, Mark D.; zur Loye, Hans-Conrad

Self-assembly of HgI2 with a semirigid ditopic 'Z' type ligand, 2,6-bis(4-pyridinylmethyl)benzo[1,2-c:4,5-c]dipyrrole-1,3,5,7(2H,6H)tetrone (L), affords the zigzag chains that interweave into a cloth-like 2-dimensional network in a two-over/two-under' (2O/2U) fashion.  HgLI2 is monoclinic, space group P21/n, Z = 4, R1 = 0.0296, wR2 = 0.0599.
Polymeric layers catenated by ribbons of rings in a three-dimensional self-assembled architecture: a nanoporous network with spongelike behavior
Carlucci, Lucia; Ciani, Gianfranco; Moret, Massimo; Proserpio, Davide M.; Rizzato, Silvia

Some examples of polymeric catenated species are: poly[2]catenane, parallel interpenetration of ladders, inclined interpenetration of ladders, catenation of simple undulating layers, and catenation of multiple layers.  A new member of this class of catenated motifs, [Cu5(bpp)8(SO4)(EtOH)(H2O)5](SO4)·EtOH·25.5H2O (1), was prepd. by self-assembly of copper(II) sulfate and 1,3-bis(4-pyridyl)propane (bpp).  The crystal structure of 1 shows the presence of 2 different and crystallog. independent polymeric motifs packed together.  One motif, the ribbons of rings, consists of 48-membered cycles, in which each ring includes 4 copper atoms and 4 bpp ligands.  The other polymeric motif of 1 is a two-dimensional tessellated sheet of (4,4) topol. which contains 2 types of copper atoms, Cu4 and Cu5, and four types of bpp ligands.  The most interesting feature of 1 is that the ribbons and the layers are entangled in a unique three-dimensional array.
Interpenetrating lattices - materials of the future

A review, with 24 refs.,.  The fascination of mankind with art and architecture has extended to the structural topol. of mols. and materials and led to deliberate syntheses of highly sym. and strained mols.  Materials comprised of interpenetrating lattices (see Figure) were discovered and there is high expectation that they will be advanced materials of the future with useful optical, elec., magnetic, catalytic, or sepn. properties.
Porous coordination-polymer crystals with gated channels specific for supercritical gases
Kitaura, Ryo; Seki, Kenji; Akiyama, George; Kitagawa, Susumu

Two new types of flexible and dynamic nanoporous frameworks (type A with mutually interdigitated 2D motifs and type B with mutually interpenetrated 3D motifs) were prepd. and examd. on their gas-adsorption properties (CO2, CH4, O2, and N2) at high pressure and ambient temp.  Type A coordination polymer, [Cu(dhbc)2(4,4'-bpy)] × H2O (I), was prepd. from Cu(NO3)2, 2,5-dihydroxybenzoic acid (Hdhbc), and 4,4'-bipyridine (monoclinic, P2/c, a = 8.167(4), b = 11.094(8), c = 15.863(2) Å, β = 99.703(4)°, Z = 2 V = 1416(1) Å3).  Release of crystal water from compd. I was obsd. during thermogravimetric anal. with increasing temp. ≤120°.  Type B coordination polymer (C13H8NO4Cu) [Cu(p-OOC-C6H4-COO)·1/2(4,4'-bpy)]n was obtained from CuII terephthalate and 4,4'-bpy according to a published procedure.  Type A coordination polymer was characterized by x-ray powder diffraction.  Adsorption and desorption isotherms were recorded for all gases at 298 K.

Interpenetrating metalorganic and inorganic 3D networks: a computer-aided systematic investigation. Part I. Analysis of the Cambridge structural database
Blatov, V. A.; Carlucci, L.; Ciani, G.; Proserpio, D. M.

The occurrence of interpenetration in metalorg. and inorg. networks has been investigated by a systematic anal. of the CSD and ICSD structural databases.  For this purpose, a novel version of TOPOS (a program package for multipurpose crystallochem. anal.) has been employed, where the procedure of recognition of interpenetrating nets is based on the representation of a crystal structure as a finite reduced graph.  In this paper we report a comprehensive list (301 Refcodes) of interpenetrating metal-org. 3D structures from CSD, that are analyzed on the basis of their topologies.  Interesting trends and novel features have been obsd. and distinct classes of interpenetrating nets have been envisaged, depending on the relationships of the individual motifs.
Entangled coordination networks with inherent features of polycatenation, polythreading, and polyknotting
Wang, Xin-Long; Qin, Chao; Wang, En-Bo; Li, Yang-Guang; Su, Zhong-Min; Xu, Lin; Carlucci, Lucia

Self-assembly of nickel salts with 4,4'-bipyridine (bpy) and the long V-shaped 4,4'-oxybis(benzoate) (oba) ligand led to three different coordination networks, [Ni2(oba)2(bpy)2(H2O)2]·bpy (1), [Ni3(oba)2(bpy)2(Hoba)2(H2O)2]·bpy·2H2O (2) and [Ni(oba)(bpy)]·2H2O (3), which were characterized by x-ray crystallog.  The structure of 1 contains a parallel polycatenation of nanotube motifs to give a layered framework, 2 has a 2-dimensional → 3-dimensional polythreaded array involving five polymeric units at a time, and 3 consists of a 3-dimensional self-penetrating binodal network with an unprecedented (4.82)(4.64.84.10) topol.
Anion control over interpenetration and framework topology in coordination networks based on homoleptic six-connected scandium nodes
Long, De-Liang; Hill, Robert J.; Blake, Alexander J.; Champness, Neil R.; Hubberstey, Peter; Wilson, Claire; Schroeder, Martin

Reaction of ScX3 (X = NO3-, CF3SO3-, ClO4-) with 4,4'-bipyridine-N,N'-dioxide (L) affords topol. distinct six-connected three-dimensional coordination frameworks, {[Sc(L)3](NO3)3}∞ (1), {[Sc(L)3](CF3SO3)3(MeOH)2.7(H2O)3}∞ (2), {[Sc(L)3](ClO4)3}∞ (3) and {[Sc(L)4(H2O)2](ClO4)3}∞ (4).  Compds. 1, 2 and 3 are networks based on octahedrally coordinated ScO6 centers bound through six O atoms from six sep. N-oxide ligands L.  Compds. 1 and 3 are doubly interpenetrated and have α-Po-type structures of 41263 topol. based upon three intersecting (4,4) nets.  The structure of 2 is unusual and shows parallel, coplanar layers of (4,4) nets connected in a crisscrossed fashion to afford a new 48668 topol.  In 4 only four ligands L bind to each ScIII center with two addnl. H2O mols. bridging metal nodes.  Significantly, the bridges formed by L do not sit in a plane and if connections through L are considered alone the resultant structure is a diamondoid array typically based upon a tetrahedral connecting node at Sc.  Five interpenetrating diamondoid networks are obsd. that are cross-bridged by H2O mols. to form a single three-dimensional array of 4867 topol.  Compd. 4 can also be viewed as incorporating two intersecting (4,4) grids based upon two ligands L and two bridging waters.  Thus, variation of anion, solvent and conditions critically affects the structures of products formed, and polymers reported herein illustrates how tectons based upon (4,4) grids can be combined and distorted to form non-NaCl topologies and even cross-bridged, multiply interpenetrated diamondoid materials.  Both compds. 2 and 4 represent unusual examples of self-penetrated coordination frameworks.
A New Self-Penetrating Uniform Net, (8,4) (or 86), Containing Planar Four-Coordinate Nodes
Tong, Ming-Liang; Chen, Xiao-Ming; Batten, Stuart R.
Journal of the American Chemical Society

Hydrothermal reaction of 3-(3-pyridyl)acrylic acid (pyaraH) with NiCl2 and NaOH gave different polymorphs at different temps. α-Ni(pyara)2(H2O)2 forms at 180°, and has a 3-dimensional polymeric structure.  The topol. of the network is that of a self-penetrating, four-coordinate (8,4) network (Schlafli symbol 86).  This is the first uniform net to contain only planar four-coordinate nodes, and it is also the first four-coordinate uniform net not to have the Schlafli symbol 66.  This fundamental network topol. was previously unrecognized.  The second polymorph, the β phase, forms from an analogous reaction at 150°, and contains 1-dimensional chains hydrogen bonded into a 3-dimensional network.  Preliminary crystal data for iron(II) and cobalt(II) complexes which are isostructural with α-Ni(pyara)2(H2O)2 are presented.
Two Polyknotted Topological Isomers of Copper(I) 3,5-Bis(4-pyridyl)pyrazolates
Zhan, Shun-Ze; Li, Dan; Zhou, Xiao-Ping; Zhou, Xin-Hui

Two unprecedented 3-dimensional polyknotted isomers of [CuI2(bppz)(SCN)]∞, arising from different linkage modes of SCN- (trans-μ2-S vs. cis-μ2-S), were obtained from 3,5-bis(4-pyridyl)-1H-pyrazole (Hbppz) and CuSCN under different conditions.  Crystal structures of the isomers and their luminescence in the solid state at room temp. are discussed.
{[Cu(mtz)]3(CuI)}n: An Unprecedented Non-interpenetrated (123)(122·14)3 Network with Triple-Stranded Helices
Huang, Xi-He; Sheng, Tian-Lu; Xiang, Sheng-Chang; Fu, Rui-Biao; Hu, Sheng-Min; Li, Ya-Min; Wu, Xin-Tao

A complex with triple-stranded helixes, {[Cu(mtz)]3(CuI)}n (Hmtz = 3,5-dimethyl-1,2,4-triazole), was obtained under hydrothermal conditions and characterized by x-ray crystallog.  The complex possesses an unprecedented non-interpenetrated (123)(122·14)3 network, which represents the 1st example of the largest gon value of the smallest ring for the Archimedean net reported so far.
Zeolite-like Copper Iodide Framework with New 66 Topology
Bi, Minghui; Li, Guanghua; Zou, Yongchun; Shi, Zhan; Feng, Shouhua

The authors have prepd. and described an unprecedented three-dimensional zeolite-like copper iodide of compn. [Cu4I4(DABCO)2]·EtOH constructed from Cu4I4(DABCO)4 (DABCO = 1,4-diazabicyclo[2.2.2]octane) supertetrahedron units.  This compd. forms a four-connected network with new 66 topol.  Its structure reveals 1-dimensional channels along the [001] direction, and the framework displays interesting self-penetration.  The title compd. shows photoluminescence at room temp. in the solid state.
A Rare Chiral Self-Catenated Network Formed by Two Cationic and One Anionic Frameworks
Zhang, Shi-Shen; Zhan, Shun-Ze; Li, Mian; Peng, Rong; Li, Dan

A chiral heterometallic complex, obtained from the solvothermal reaction of [Zn(4-pytpy)2](BF4)2 [4-pytpy = 4'-(4-pyridyl)-2,2':6',2''-terpyridine] and CuCN, exhibits a rare self-catenated network formed by two 3-dimensional cationic and one 3-dimensional anionic frameworks.
Design of Novel Three-Dimensional Coordination Polymers Based on Triangular Trinuclear Copper 1,2,4-Triazolate Units
Zhai, Quan-Guo; Lu, Can-Zhong; Chen, Shu-Mei; Xu, Xin-Jiang; Yang, Wen-Bin

By controlling the molar ratios of Cu dichloride dihydrate and 1,2,4-triazole (trz), the authors generated novel three-dimensional coordination polymers constructed from μ3-oxo or μ3-Cl triangular Cu units, exhibiting six-connected porous self-penetrating net, graphite layer, and inorg.-org. hybrid network structures, resp.  The prepn. and crystal structure of [Cu3(μ3-O)(μ3-trz)3]2[OH]2·15H2O (1), Cu[Cu3(μ3-O)(μ3-trz)3Cl3] (2) and [Cu2(μ3-trz)(μ3-Cl)2] (3) are reported.
Four-, and six-connected entangled frameworks based on flexible bis(imidazole) ligands and long dicarboxylate anions
Yang, Jin; Ma, Jian-Fang; Liu, Ying-Ying; Batten, Stuart R.

Four- and six-connected entangled structures, [Cd(oba)(bbi)]·0.5H2O (1), [Ni(oba)(bbi)]2·H2O (2), [Co(bpea)(bbi)]·H2O (3), [Co2(bpea)2(bbi)2]·1.5H2O (4), [Cd(oba)(1,4-bix)] (5), and [Ni2(oba)2(1,4-bix)(H2O)2] (6), where oba = 4,4'-oxybis(benzoate), bpea = biphenylethene-4,4'-dicarboxylate, 1,4-bix = 1,4-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene, and bbi = 1,1'-(1,4-butanediyl)bis(imidazole), were successfully synthesized through a hydrothermal process.  The structures of 1 and 2 both consist of two interpenetrating CdSO4 nets.  In 1, the two nets are related by symmetry.  By comparison, the individual nets are, unusually, crystallog. distinct in 2.  The structures of 3 and 4 both contain interpenetrating diamond networks.  In 3, there are 6 interpenetrating nets, and they show the usual mode of interpenetration.  For 4, however, there are 7 nets, and a rare 'abnormal' [4 + 3] interpenetration mode is obsd.  In 5, the oba and 1,4-bix ligands linked the Cd(II) atoms into a deeply corrugated 2-dimensional sheet.  The corrugated 2-dimensional sheets polycatenate each other in a parallel manner with DOC (degree of catenation) = 2, yielding a rare 2-dimensional → 3-dimensional parallel polycatenation net.  In 6, the dinuclear Ni(II) units are bridged by the oba ligands to generate a 2-dimensional (4,4) square-grid with a rhombic window.  It is interesting that the two identical (4,4) square-grids show 2-dimensional → 2-dimensional parallel interpenetration but are then further crosslinked by the 1,4-bix ligands to yield an unusual 3-dimensional self-penetrating net with an unique 6-connected 44.611 topol.  The importance of bbi conformations and metal sources in the framework formation of complexes 1-6 was unraveled.  Their IR spectra, powder XRD and photoluminescent properties were also studied.
An unprecedented eight-connected self-penetrating network based on pentanuclear zinc cluster building blocks
Wang, Xin-Long; Qin, Chao; Wang, En-Bo; Su, Zhong-Min; Xu, Lin; Batten, Stuart R.

The 1st eight-connected self-penetrating metal-org. framework, based on pentanuclear Zn cluster building blocks, defines a new self-penetrating topol. for eight-connected networks and represents the highest connected topol. presently known for self-penetrating systems.  [Zn5(μ3-OH)2(bdc)4(phen)2] (I) was prepd. from Zn(NO3)2, 1,4-benzenedicarboxylic acid (H2bdc) and phen in presence of H2O.  I is triclinic, space group P‾1, Z = 1, R1 = 0.0397, wR2 = 0.0889.
Metal nuclearity modulated four-, six-, and eight-connected entangled frameworks based on mono-, bi-, and trimetallic cores as nodes
Wang, Xin-Long; Qin, Chao; Wang, En-Bo; Su, Zhong-Min

To study the relation between network connectivity and metal nuclearity, the authors designed and synthesized three-dimensional (3D) entangled coordination frameworks based on different metal cores, [Zn2(bdc)2(L)2]·2H2O (1), [Zn(bdc)(L)0.5] (2), [Zn(oba)(L)0.5] (3) and [Cd3(bdc)3(L)2(H2O)2] (4) by self-assembly of d10 metal salts with the flexible long-chain ligand 1,4-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-yl)butane (L), and with the rigid and nonrigid arom. dicarboxylate ligands 1,4-benzenedicarboxylate (bdc) and 4,4'-oxybis(benzoate) (oba).  Compd. 1 exhibits a 3-fold interpenetrated diamondoid array typically based on a tetrahedral 2nd building unit (SBU) at a single Zn center.  Compd. 2 adopts a 3-fold interpenetrated α-Po-type network that is built from bimetallic cores as six-connected vertexes.  The structure of 3 also consists of dinuclear units comprising a novel (3,4)-connected 3-fold interpenetrated net with complex (4.6 × 10)-(4.62 × 103) topol. when single Zn centers act as four-connected nodes (or the α-Po topol. if dinuclear units are considered as six-connected nodes).  4, Derived from a cross-linked 5-fold interpenetrated diamond-like substructure, is an unusual example of a self-penetrating coordination framework displaying an unprecedented eight-connected 42068 topol. with trinuclear Cd clusters as eight-connected nodes which, to the authors' knowledge, not only defines a new topol. for eight-connected coordination networks, but also represents the highest connected topol. presently known for self-penetrating systems.  Detailed structural comparison of these complexes indicates that the increase in metal nuclearity induces the progressive increase in the connectivities of the ultimate nets: i.e., the metal nuclearity plays a significant role in tuning the connectivity of a specific network.  The thermal and luminescent properties of these compds. are discussed.
Exceptional Self-Penetrating Networks Containing Unprecedented Quintuple-Stranded Molecular Braid, 9-Fold Meso Helices, and 17-Fold Interwoven Helices
Xiao, Dong-Rong; Li, Yang-Guang; Wang, En-Bo; Fan, Lin-Lin; An, Hai-Yan; Su, Zhong-Min; Xu, Lin

Self-assembly of long V-shaped ligands and d10 metal salts in the presence of a linear bidentate ligand affords two unprecedented self-penetrating coordination networks {[Zn4(bptc)2(bpy)4]·(C5H3N)·4H2O}n (1) and {[Cd2(sdba)2(bpy)(H2O)2]·2H2O}n (2) (bptc = 3,3',4,4'-benzophenonetetracarboxylate, sdba = 4,4'-sulfonyldibenzoate, bpy = 4,4'-bipyridine).  Their structures were detd. by single-crystal x-ray diffraction analyses and further characterized by elemental analyses, IR spectra, x-ray powder diffraction, and TG analyses.  1 Adopts a novel 3-dimensional framework contg. three types of mol. braids, among which the quintuple-stranded mol. braid represents the highest-stranded mol. braid presently known for entangled systems.  2 Is an uncommon self-penetrating 2-dimensional network contg. pseudo-Borromean links and double-stranded helixes.  More interestingly, when the strong H bonds between layers are taken into account, the resulting net of 2 becomes an eight-connected 3-dimensional self-penetrating network with an unprecedented (421.67) topol., which represents the highest connected topol. presently known in self-penetrating systems.  Also, the photoluminescent properties of 1 and 2 were studied.
Construction of coordination networks with high connectivity: a new 8-connected self-penetrating network based on tetranuclear metal clusters
Li, Zhi-Gang; Wang, Guan-Hua; Jia, Heng-Qing; Hu, Ning-Hai; Xu, Jing-Wei; Batten, Stuart R.

Two highly connected cobalt(II) and zinc(II) coordination polymers, Co4(2,5-pydc)4(bpe) (1) and Zn4(2,5-pydc)4(bpe) (2), (2,5-pydcH2 = pyridine-2,5-dicarboxylic acid, bpe = 1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethylene) with tetranuclear metal clusters as the nodes of network were prepd. and characterized by x-ray crystallog.  They are the first examples of an 8-connected self-penetrating net based on a crosslinked α-Po subnet.
There is no corresponding record for this reference.

A review.  Metal-org. frameworks are a recently-identified class of porous polymeric material, consisting of metal ions linked together by org. bridging ligands, and are a new development on the interface between mol. coordination chem. and materials science.  A range of novel structures was prepd. which feature amongst the largest pores known for cryst. compds., very high sorption capacities and complex sorption behavior not seen in aluminosilicate zeolites.  The development of synthetic approaches to these materials and studies of their properties are reviewed.
From molecules to crystal engineering. Supramolecular isomerism and polymorphism in network solids

A review with 299 refs. on how the advances in supramol. chem. have impacted the manner in which chemists view the existence of single crystals and the design of new cryst. phases.  Coordination polymers, H-bonded networks, and supramol. isomerism and polymorphism are considered.
A Redox-Active Two-Dimensional Coordination Polymer: Preparation of Silver and Gold Nanoparticles and Crystal Dynamics on Guest Removal
Suh, Myunghyun Paik; Moon, Hoi Ri; Lee, Eun Young; Jang, Seung Yeon
Journal of the American Chemical Society

A two-dimensional (2D) square-grid coordination polymer, {[Ni(cyclam)]2[BPTC]}n·2nH2O (1), was assembled from [Ni(cyclam)](ClO4)2 (cyclam = 1,4,8,11-tetraazacyclotetradecane) and H4BPTC (H4BPTC = 1,1'-biphenyl-2,2',6,6'-tetracarboxylic acid) in H2O/MeOH (2.5:1, vol./vol.) in the presence of NEt3.  When solid 1 was immersed in EtOH solns. of AgNO3 (1.3 × 10-1 M) and NaAuCl4·2H2O (3.4 × 10-2 M), resp., for 5 min at room temp., solids including Ag (3.7 ± 0.4 nm, diam.) and Au (2 nm, diam.) nanoparticles were formed by the redox reactions between Ni(II) ions incorporated in 1 and metal ions, as evidenced by HRTEM images, EPR, and XPS spectra.  When single-crystal 1 was heated at 180° under 10-5 Torr for 24 h, it was transformed to dehydrated compd. {[Ni(cyclam)]2[BPTC]}n (2) in the single-crystal-to-single-crystal manner.  The x-ray crystal structure of 2 reveals extensive dynamic motions of the mol. components in response to guest removal, involving rotation of the carboxylate and macrocycle, swing of the biphenyl, and bending of the macrocyclic coordination plane toward the carboxylate plane, which reduces the interlayer distance.
Interweaving of Triple-Helical and Extended Metal-O-Metal Single-Helical Chains with the Same Helix Axis in a 3D Metal-Organic Framework
Zang, Shuangquan; Su, Yang; Li, Yizhi; Ni, Zhaoping; Zhu, Huizhen; Meng, Qingjin

A novel 3-dimensional metal-org. framework [Cd2(m-bptc)(4,4'-bpy)0.5(H2O)4]·H2O (1; m-H4bptc = 1,1'-biphenyl-2,3',3,4'-tetracarboxylic acid, 4,4'-bpy = 4,4'-bipyridine) with interweaving of triple- and single-helical chains was obtained based on hydro(solvo)thermal reactions.

Zang, Shuangquan; Su, Yang; Duan, Chunying; Li, Yizhi; Zhu, Huizhen; Meng, Qingjin

A novel host-guest metal-org. compd. [Cd4(bptc)2(bpy)(H2O)8]·5.5H2O with both chiral hydrophilic and achiral hydrophobic channels was obtained through the reaction of Cd(II) ion, 4,4'-bipyridine (bpy) and a versatile asym. ligand of H4bptc (H4bptc = 1,1'-biphenyl-2,2',3,3'-tetracarboxylic acid) based on hydro(solvo)thermal reactions.
High H2 adsorption in a microporous metal-organic framework with open metal sites
Chen, Banglin; Ockwig, Nathan W.; Millward, Andrew R.; Contreras, Damacio S.; Yaghi, Omar M.

A copper-based metal-org. framework (MOF) has been synthesized, and its structure has been solved by X-ray crystallog.  The remarkably high hydrogen adsorption properties (2.47 wt%) of this compd. have been studied.
High H2 adsorption by coordination-framework materials
Lin, Xiang; Jia, Junhua; Zhao, Xuebo; Thomas, K. Mark; Blake, Alexander J.; Walker, Gavin S.; Champness, Neil R.; Hubberstey, Peter; Schroeder, Martin

Three coordination frameworks with different pore sizes were prepd. from CuII salt and carboxylate ligands of various lengths.  Comparison of their sorption properties reveals that smaller pores allow higher densities of adsorbed H2, whereas larger pores allow higher max. H2 storage capacities.  The structures of the three structural analogs are also reported.
Transformation of a metal-organic framework from the NbO to PtS net
Chen, Banglin; Ockwig, Nathan W.; Fronczek, Frank R.; Contreras, Damacio S.; Yaghi, Omar M.

Two metal-org. frameworks (MOFs), MOF-501 and MOF-502, resp., formulated as Co2(BPTC)(H2O)5·Gx and Co2(BPTC)(H2O)(DMF)2·Gx (BPTC = 3,3',5,5'-biphenyltetracarboxylate; G = guest mols.), were synthesized and structurally characterized, and their topologies are based on the NbO (MOF-501) and PtS (MOF-502) nets.  Heating MOF-501 in soln. results in the more thermodynamically favored MOF-502.
Benzene-templated hydrothermal synthesis of metal-organic frameworks with selective sorption properties
Choi, Eun-Young; Park, Kyungsoo; Yang, Cheol-Min; Kim, Hyejin; Son, Jung-Ho; Lee, Soon W.; Lee, Young Hee; Min, Dongwon; Kwon, Young-Uk

The authors report two metal-org. frameworks [Co3(ndc)3(bipyen)1.5]·H2O (1) and [Co2(ndc)2(bipyen)]·C6H6·H2O (2) (bipyen = trans-1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethylene, H2ndc = 2,6-naphthalenedicarboxylic acid).  These compds. were both synthesized from identical hydrothermal reaction conditions except that benzene was added to the reaction for 2.  Crystal structures show that the two compds. have triply interpenetrated three-dimensional frameworks and these frameworks have the same primary structure of a two-dimensional network of interconnected [Co2(O2CR)4/2] (R = naphthalene group) paddle-wheels and bridging bipyen ligands.  Both compds. have guest H2O mols. and 2 has guest benzene mols.  Structural transformations of the host accompanied guest removal, which can be monitored by powder x-ray diffraction.  N2 adsorption data of 2 show that there are two different types of pores corresponding to the benzene and H2O pores.  Upon exposure to vapors of several org. mols., the heat-treated sample of 2 adsorbs benzene and cyclohexene, but does not adsorb toluene, (o-, m-, and p-)xylenes, cycloheptatriene, or cyclohexane.
Synthesis, X-ray crystal structures, and gas sorption properties of pillared square grid nets based on paddle-wheel motifs: Implications for hydrogen storage in porous materials
Chun, Hyungphil; Dybtsev, Danil N.; Kim, Hyunuk; Kim, Kimoon

A systematic modulation of org. ligands connecting dinuclear paddle-wheel motifs leads to isomorphous metal-org. porous materials that have a three-dimensional connectivity and interconnected pores.  Arom. dicarboxylates such as 1,4-benzenedicarboxylate (1,4-bdc), tetramethylterephthalate (tmbdc), 1,4-naphthalenedicarboxylate (1,4-ndc), tetrafluoroterephthalate (tfbdc), or 2,6-naphthalenedicarboxylate (2,6-ndc) are linear linkers that form two-dimensional layers, and diamine ligands, 4-diazabicyclo[2.2.2]octane (dabco) or 4,4'-dipyridyl (bpy), coordinate at both sides of Zn2 paddle-wheel units to bridge the layers vertically.  The resulting open frameworks [Zn2(1,4-bdc)2(dabco)] (1), [Zn2(1,4-bdc)(tmbdc)(dabco)] (2), [Zn2(tmbdc)2(dabco)] (3), [Zn2(1,4-ndc)2(dabco)] (4), [Zn2(tfbdc)2(dabco)] (5), and [Zn2(tmbdc)2(bpy)] (8) possess varying size of pores and free apertures originating from the side groups of the 1,4-bdc derivs.  [Zn2(1,4-bdc)2(bpy)] (6) and [Zn2(2,6-ndc)2(bpy)] (7) have two- and 3-fold interpenetrating structures, resp.  The noninterpenetrating frameworks (1-5 and 8) possess surface areas at 1450-2090 m2g-1 and H sorption capacities of 1.7-2.1% at 78 K and 1 atm.  A detailed anal. of the sorption data in conjunction with structural similarities and differences concludes that porous materials with straight channels and large openings do not perform better than those with wavy channels and small openings in terms of H storage through physisorption.
Strong H2 Binding and Selective Gas Adsorption within the Microporous Coordination Solid Mg3(O2C-C10H6-CO2)3
Journal of the American Chemical Society

The synthesis of Mg3(NDC)3(DEF)4 (NDC = 2,6-naphthalenedicarboxylate, DEF = N,N-diethylformamide, 1), the first porous metal-org. framework solid incorporating Mg2+ ions, is reported.  Its structure consists of linear Mg3 units linked via NDC bridges to form a three-dimensional framework, featuring one-dimensional channels filled with DEF mols.  Significantly, its framework is fully analogous to that obsd. within Zn3(NDC)3(CH3OH)2·2DMF·H2O (2), demonstrating that Mg2+ ions can directly substitute for the heavier Zn2+ ions.  Compd. 1 is readily desolvated by heating at 190 °C to give the microporous solid Mg3(NDC)3, exhibiting a BET surface area of 190 m2/g.  Adsorption isotherms measured at 77 and 87 K indicate high H2 adsorption enthalpies in the range 7.0-9.5 kJ/mol, depending on the degree of loading.  In addn., the material displays selective adsorption of H2 or O2 over N2 or CO, suggesting possible applications in gas sepn. technologies.
1D Helix, 2D Brick-Wall and Herringbone, and 3D Interpenetration d10 Metal-Organic Framework Structures Assembled from Pyridine-2,6-dicarboxylic Acid N-Oxide
Wen, Li-Li; Dang, Dong-Bin; Duan, Chun-Ying; Li, Yi-Zhi; Tian, Zheng-Fang; Meng, Qing-Jin

Five novel interesting d10 metal coordination polymers, [Zn(PDCO)(H2O)2]n (1, PDCO = pyridine-2,6-dicarboxylic acid N-oxide), [Zn2(PDCO)2(4,4'-bpy)2(H2O)2·3H2O]n (2, bpy = 4,4'-bipyridine), [Zn(PDCO)(bix)]n (3, bix = 1,4-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene), [Zn(PDCO)(bbi)·0.5H2O]n (4, bbi = 1,1'-(1,4-butanediyl)bis(imidazole)), and [Cd(PDCO)(bix)1.5·1.5H2O]n (5), were synthesized under hydrothermal conditions and structurally characterized.  Polymer 1 possesses a 1-dimensional (1D) helical chainlike structure with 41 helixes running along the c-axis with a pitch of 10.090 Å.  Polymer 2 has an infinite chiral two-dimensional (2D) brick-wall-like layer structure in the ac plane built from achiral components, while both 3 and 4 exhibit an infinite 2-dimensional herringbone architecture, resp. extended in the a.c. and ab plane.  Polymer 5 features a most remarkable and unique three-dimensional (3D) porous framework with 2-fold interpenetration related by symmetry, which contains channels in the b and c directions, both distributed in a rectangular grid fashion.  Compds. 1-5, with systematic variation in dimensionality from 1-dimensional to 2-dimensional to 3-dimensional, are the 1st examples of d10 metal coordination polymers into which pyridinedicarboxylic acid N-oxide was introduced.  Polymers 1, 4, and 5 display strong blue fluorescent emissions in the solid state.  Polymer 3 exhibits a strong SHG response, estd. to be ∼0.9 times that of urea.
Synthesis and Crystal Structures of Multidimensional Coordination Polymers Based on W/Cu/S Clusters with Flexible Imidazole Ligands
Song, Li; Li, Jianrong; Lin, Ping; Li, Zhihua; Li, Tao; Du, Shaowu; Wu, Xintao

Reactions of [WES3]2- (E = S, O) with CuX (X = NCS, CN, I) in the presence of bix (bix = 1,4-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene) in DMF or MeCN gave two novel 2-D → 3D interpenetrating coordination polymers [S2W2S6Cu4(bix)2]n (1) and {[WS4Cu4(NCS)2(bix)3]·MeCN}n (2), a noninterpenetrating 3-dimensional polymer {[WS4Cu2(bix)]·DMF}n (3), and two 2-dimensional sheet polymers [WS4Cu3(CN)(bix)]n (4) and {[OWS3Cu3(bix)2][I]·DMF·2H2O}n (5), depending on the reaction temp. and the reagents used.  Compd. 1 contains a hexagonal prism of W2Cu4S6 cluster core, which serves as a 4-connecting node to link equiv. nodes via bix ligands, forming a 2-dimensional (4,4) net.  In 2, a WCu4S4 core, which also acts as a 4-connecting node, connects the neighboring nodes either through single or double bix bridges, affording a different 2-dimensional (4,4) sheet.  Inclined interpenetration occurs between two stacks of 2-dimensional sheets in the total structure of 1, while 2 involves a parallel interpenetration between the adjacent layers, both creating a 3-dimensional network.  Compds. 1 and 2 represent the first examples of interpenetrating (4,4) frameworks with clusters as nodes and bidentate pyridyl-based ligands as linkers.  Unlike 1 and 2, compd. 3 has a noninterpenetrating 3-dimensional network, which is composed of the inorg. 1-dimensional (WS4Cu2)n chains linked by cis and trans bix ligands.  Compd. 4 features an inorg. 1-dimensional (WS4Cu3)n chain structure, which is linked by CN groups and bix ligands to form an infinite 2-dimensional network.  Compd. 5 is a 2-dimensional layer polymer with large inner cavities.
Two 2-Fold Interpenetrated Frameworks Showing Different Topologies Based on the Isomerous Benzenedicarboxylate Mixed with a Flexible N,N'-Type Ligand
Chen, Pang-Kuan; Che, Yun-Xia; Xue, Lin; Zheng, Ji-Min

This paper presents two 2-fold parallel interpenetrated polymers, ZnCo(bpp)(m-BDC)2 (1) and Co(bpp)(p-BDC)(2), based on isomerous 1,3-benzenedicarboxylate (m-BDC) and 1,4-benzenedicarboxylate (p-BDC).  Compds. 1 and 2 were hydrothermally synthesized and characterized by single-crystal x-ray diffraction, IR, ICP, TGA, DSC, and element anal.  1 Crystallizes in the triclinic space group P‾1 and affords a three-dimensional (3D) six-connected α-Po network, whereas 2 crystallizes in the orthorhombic space group Pbca and gives an usual 2-dimensional four-connected 44 grid.  These interpenetrated topologies should be attributed to the high functionality and adaptability of the 1,3-bis(4-pyridyl)propane (bpp) ligand.

Chen, Pang-Kuan; Che, Yun-Xia; Zheng, Ji-Min; Batten, Stuart R.

The two-dimensional heteropolynuclear metal-org. framework [Co3Zn2(m-BDC)4(μ3-OH)2(μ2-OH2)2(H2O)4].4.5H2O (1) (m-H2BDC = 1,3-benzenedicarboxylic acid) has been hydrothermally synthesized and characterized by single-crystal X-ray diffraction, IR spectrum, X-ray powder diffraction, and elemental anal.  Our exptl. results signify that the formation of the compd. is highly medium-selective and temp.-sensitive in the hydrothermal system.  Interestingly, the complex undergoes a single-crystal to single-crystal structural phase transition from orthorhombic Pmna to monoclinic P21/c (1') at very low temp. of about 156.5 K.  In this process, we found two topol. different water tapes.  More importantly, the magnetic property of the target compd. was also intensively investigated in the temp. range of 2-300 K and shows the coexistence of spin canting and field-induced metamagnetism.
Initial Observation of Magnetization Hysteresis and Quantum Tunneling in Mixed Manganese-Lanthanide Single-Molecule Magnets
Mishra, Abhudaya; Wernsdorfer, Wolfgang; Abboud, Khalil A.; Christou, George
Journal of the American Chemical Society

The prepn. of a new family of mixed transition metal/lanthanide clusters is reported.  The reaction of [Mn3O(O2CPh)6(py)2(H2O)] with Ln(NO3)3 (Ln = Nd, Gd, Dy, Ho, and Eu) in a 1:2 molar ratio in MeOH/MeCN (1:20 vol./vol.) leads to dark crystals in 55-60% isolated yield of complexes all contg. the [Mn11Ln4]45+ core.  The Dy compd. gave out-of-phase a.c. susceptibility signals, suggesting it might be a single-mol. magnet (SMM).  This was confirmed by the observation of magnetization hysteresis loops.  An Arrhenius plot constructed from magnetization decay data gave a barrier to relaxation of 9.3 K and showed the temp.-independent relaxation at very low temps. indicative of quantum tunneling of magnetization.  This is the initial demonstration of hysteresis and quantum behavior in a mixed 3d/4f SMM.

The largest lanthanide-manganese cluster complex, [DyIII6MnIII4MnIV2(H2shi)4(Hshi)2(shi)10(MeOH)10(H2O)2]·9MeOH·8H2O (H3shi = salicylhydroxamic acid) was prepd., its crystal structure detd. and its magnetic properties studied. Zaleski, Curtis M.; Kampf, Jeff W.; Mallah, Talal; Kirk, Martin L.; Pecoraro, Vincent L.
A DyIII4MnIII6 complex with a metallacrown (MC)-like topol. possesses frequency-dependent magnetic behavior, indicating possible single-mol. magnet behavior.

Ma, Jian-Fang; Yang, Jin; Zheng, Guo-Li; Li, Li; Liu, Jing-Fu

A novel coordination polymer {[Cu(L1)(L2)(H2O)]·5H2O}n (1), where L1 = 1,1'-(1,4-butanediyl)bis(imidazole) and L2 = m-phthalate anion, was obtained by using an unusual crystn. process (through evapg. an ammoniacal soln. of 1).  It crystallizes in the orthorhombic space group Pna21, which belongs to the crystal class mm2, with a 9.0521(18), b 15.401(3), and c 17.141(3) Å, α = β = γ 90°, and Z = 4. TGA and x-ray powder diffraction (XRPD) patterns for 1 imply that the framework of the compd. cannot be recovered by hydration after thermal dehydration.

OLEX: new software for visualization and analysis of extended crystal structures
Dolomanov, Oleg V.; Blake, Alexander J.; Champness, Neil R.; Schroeder, Martin

New software (OLEX) for the visualization and anal. of extended crystal structures was developed .  This software has a Windows-compatible mouse-driven graphical interface which gives full control over all structural elements.  OLEX provides the user with tools to construct topol. networks, visualize interpenetrating or overlapping fragments, and analyze networks constructed fully or partially by exploiting short interactions.  It is also easy to generate conventional ellipsoid, ball-and-stick or packing plots.
Synthesis, structure and magnetic properties of the first Mn(II)-Gd(III) heteronuclear complex

The synthesis and crystal structure of a novel pentanuclear Mn(II)-Gd(III) complex, [Gd2Mn3(CH2C(CH3)COO)12(2,2'-bipy)2], are reported.  Magnetic measurements conclusively demonstrated antiferromagnetic behavior between Mn(II) and Gd(III) for this complex.

The zinc(II) coordination polymer [Zn3(BDC)3(L)] (1, BDC = 1,4-benzenedicarboxylate, L = 1,2-bis(2-(imidazol-1-yl)ethoxy)ethane), exhibiting an eight-connected 36·418·53·6 net with trinuclear zinc clusters as secondary building units, was hydrothermally synthesized and characterized by x-ray crystallog.
Structures, photoluminescence, up-conversion, and magnetism of two- and three-dimensional rare-Earth coordination polymers with multicarboxylate linkages
Yang, Jin; Yue, Qi; Li, Guo-Dong; Cao, Jun-Jun; Li, Guang-Hua; Chen, Jie-Sheng

Four new rare-earth compds., [Eu(NDC)1.5(DMF)2] (1), [Nd2(NDC)3(DMF)4]·H2O (2), [La2(NDC)3(DMF)4]·0.5H2O (3), and [Eu(BTC)(H2O)] (4), where NDC = 1,4-naphthalenedicarboxylate, BTC = 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylate, were synthesized through preheating and cooling-down crystn.  Compds. 1-3 possess similar two-dimensional structures in which the NDC ligands link MIII (M = La, Nd, and Eu) ions of two adjacent double chains constructed by NDC ligands and dinuclear MIII building units.  In compd. 4, the EuIII ion is seven-coordinated by O atoms from six BTC ligands and one terminal H2O mol. in a distorted pentagonal-bipyramidal coordination environment.  If the BTC ligand and the EuIII ion are regarded as six-connected nodes, resp., the structure of compd. 4 can be well described as a three-dimensional six-connected net.  Also, compds. 1 and 4 exhibit strong red luminescence upon 355-nm excitation.  Compd. 2 displays interesting emissions in the near-IR region, and yellow (580 nm) pumping of this compd. results in UV and intense blue emissions through an up-conversion process.  The magnetic properties of compds. 1, 2, and 4 were studied through measurement of their magnetic susceptibilities at 4-300 K.
